channel.title: talk | Ian Buller, Ph.D., M.A.
channel.copyright: © Ian Buller, 2021 · Opinions expressed are my own

item.title: International Society for Environmental Epidemiology 2021
item.description:
I presented my oral abstract entitled “Roadway Proximity and Lung Cancer Risk in NIH-AARP Diet and Health Study Participants” at the 33rd Annual Conference of the International Society for Environmental Epidemiology held virtually due to the global COVID-19 pandemic. I was also a co-author on three abstracts:

  1. “Residential proximity to animal feeding operations and mortality among postmenopausal women in the Iowa Women’s Health Study” led by Dr. Jessica Madrigal
  2. “Residential proximity to animal feeding operations and risk of lymphohematopoietic cancers in the Iowa Women’s Health Study” led by Dr. Jard Fisher
  3. “Ethylene oxide emissions and risk of breast cancer and Non-Hodgkin lymphoma in a large U.S. cohort” led by Dr. Rena Jones

item.title: Society for Epidemiologic Research 2021
item.description: I presented my invited talk entitled “Estimating environmental mixtures in a geospatial context” in a symposium entitled “Implementing geolocation-based exposure assessments” at the Society for Epidemiologic Reserach 2021 annual meeting held virtually due to the global COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Lightning Talk at NIEHS Workshop
item.description: I presented a lightning talk entitled “Geographic Variation in the Oral Microbiome of NIH-AARP Diet and Health Study Participants” at a National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences workshop entitled Impact of Environmental Exposures on the Microbiome and Human Health held virtually due to the global COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Invited Presentation for the DCEG Geospatial Analysis Working Group
item.description:
Derek Brown, Ph.D., M.S. and I presented our “Spatial Power” webtool for the NCI Division of Cancer Epidemiology and Genetics January 2021 monthly Geographic Analysis Working Group meeting. Spatial Power is an upcomping webtool to calculate power for spatial statistics. Stay tuned for its launch.

Update: Spatial Power was successfully launched on May 20, 2021

item.title: A Place for Spatial Analysis in the Cancer Control Continuum
item.description: I gave an invited talk at the National Cancer Institute entitled “A place for spatial analysis in the Cancer Control Continuum.” The talk was an overview of my work in progress over the past year in the Cancer Prevention Fellowship Program. The talk was recorded, so please contact me if you are interested in viewing the talk.
